result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution, the amount of which is to be determined within 30 days, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

Pay costs on each count of the action, including domestic abuse surcharge.  Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: payment made 7-12-17 to CS--judge requested cancellation
Letter to defendant with copy of commitment order
Letter to defendant ref no follow-up on payments/employment/drivers license

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court. Judge asked for explanation about non-appearance on 5-25-17 and lack of payment/contact.  Defendant stated he is in the process of getting his drivers license back due to an OWI assessment not being completed from 17 years ago; assessment completed yesterday, going to DMV today to try to get license re-instated. Judge stated that the drivers license issue had not been previously discussed.  Defendant stated he just paid $500.00 to Walworth County for child support.  He also did not receive probate check as stated at April 27, 2017 hearing.  Did not get job, yet, with Oscar Boldt Company due to not having a drivers license.  Is currently working on "Clarence's" building. Will get paid and bring $200.00 in on Monday, June 5, 2017 and set up wage assignment if Boldt job has been attained. Judge gives defendant one (1) week---until June 8, 2017 to get drivers license and job and to let courts know status.  Bench warrant canceled.

Defendant Paul L Peterson not in court.  No information received from Defendant from last RH on 4-27-17.  Notice for today's hearing sent and not returned.  Judge issues Bench Warrant.  Bench Warrant issued on 05CF155.
Review hearing on May 25, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on status. Defendant advises that he was released from jail last Wednesday, has job lined up with Oscar Boldt (building library in Egg Harbor), hopes to have a substantial payment made by May 3, advises of family issues. Discussion regarding inheritance. Defendant believes he can pay from that money. Further discussion regarding family issues. Court reviews amount due, questions how much Defendant will pay. Defendant will pay $400 by 5/5/17, owes $3000 on child support in Walworth County, thinks he can pay $50 a month after that, is trying to get apartment, has no problem with wage assignment once he gets working. Court will expect $400 by 5/5/17 with wage assignment. Court advises Defendant to get name and address where wage assignment should be sent.  Review hearing scheduled for August 10, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court, in custody. Defendant states he was just told he is on 30 day PO hold, can't get job because of hold. Discussion regarding sale of land, child support obligations. Court Orders Commitment Order stayed. Review hearing scheduled for April 27, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Court clarifies - Commitment stayed until 3/21/17.

Defendant Paul L Peterson appeared by video conference. Court questions Defendant on how he intends to pay obligations. Defendant pays child support in 3 counties, is not currently employed, will be starting with Miron Construction in the next couple of weeks. Court reviews balance/receipt history. Defendant can try to make payments, pays $1300/month in child support, is trying to get that reduced. Court questions child support payments, employment. Defendant will be making $32 an hour, full time, if he gets in with Miron. Defendant is willing to sit out 3 commitments, make minimal payments on the rest. Defendant would agree to wage assignment. Court questions if Defendant can pay $500/month. Defendant isn't sure he'll be getting job with Miron, work would start in appox. week to week and a half. Court wants Defendant back on March 21 to advise of status with Miron. Review scheduled for March 21, 2017 at 9:15.
Defendant in custody.
$25/WK - ABR

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Paul L Peterson in custody. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, charge, max. penalties, receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant, recommendation contained therein. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations.
from DOC to Court re: restitution
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Door County Restitution Summary

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court with attorney Jeffrey Cano.  Defendant Paul L Peterson in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises of plea agrement.  Court reviews max. penalties, elements.  Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 4.  Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 4.  Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution.  Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations.  Bond no longer in effect.
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2013 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court with attorney Greg Gerbers.  Defendant in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests prelim within time limits, advises that it is likely that prelim will be waived, but doesn't want to speak for Atty Maciolek.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2013 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant in custody.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Paul L Peterson in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, advises this is a Br. 2 case, only conducting bond hearing today, case will remain a Br. 2 case. State recites history of case, requests cash bond with condition of absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not asking court to impose the no contact with J.C. as he's probably been having contact with her while he was on the lamb. Defense gives argument on bond. Court makes statement, sets cash bond. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2013 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Mark W Hunter in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews issuance of warrant.  Defense advises that Defendant did not receive notice of this hearing, has had no contact with Defendant.  Court questions State, who advises that witnesses were canceled yesterday.  Nothing further will be set at this time based on outstanding warrant.
by Defendant
Person shall be held on $750 cash bond which became effective at 4:30 on January 12, 2010.
Preliminary hearing on January 27, 2010 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant is to post $750 cash by 4:30 on 1/12/10 or report back to jail.  Other conditions remain the same.
to signature bond

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court  with attorney Mark W Hunter.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense advises that Defendant could post $750 bond, requests that he be released for one day to post money.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Set prelim.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 12/31/09.
No contact direct or indirect with June C.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Return 1/11/10, 10:00.
